message:
A new Process Automation Manager KIE server application have been created in your project.
The username/password needed for accessing the application are stored in "${CREDENTIALS_SECRET}" secret as
KIE_ADMIN_USER and KIE_ADMIN_PWD

You must create the secret named "${CREDENTIALS_SECRET}" containing the KIE_ADMIN_USER and KIE_ADMIN_PWD values and the secret named "${KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_SECRET}" containing the ${KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_KEYSTORE} file used for serving secure content.

annotations.description: Application template for a managed KIE Server with an external database, for Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.7 - Deprecated
annotations.openshift.io/display-name: Red Hat Process Automation Manager 7.7 managed KIE Server with an external database
annotations.template.openshift.io/long-description: This template defines resources needed to execute Rules and Processes on Red Hat Process Automation Manager KIE server 7.7, including application deployment configuration, secure and insecure http communication, using a external database. Template for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform version 3.11. Deprecated since Red Hat Process Automation Manager version 7.5; consider using the Red Hat Business Automation Operator.

annotations.description: All the KIE server web server's ports.
The JGroups ping port for clustering.
Route for KIE server's http service.
Route for KIE server's https service.

parameters.description: The name for the application.
parameters.name: APPLICATION_NAME

parameters.description: Maven mirror that the KIE server must use. If you configure a mirror, this mirror must contain all artifacts that are required for deploying your services.
parameters.name: MAVEN_MIRROR_URL

parameters.description: Maven mirror configuration for KIE server.
parameters.name: MAVEN_MIRROR_OF

parameters.description: The id to use for the maven repository. If set, it can be excluded from the optionally configured mirror by adding it to MAVEN_MIRROR_OF. For example: external:*,!repo-rhpamcentr,!repo-custom. If MAVEN_MIRROR_URL is set but MAVEN_MIRROR_ID is not set, an id will be generated randomly, but won't be usable in MAVEN_MIRROR_OF.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_ID

parameters.description: Fully qualified URL to a Maven repository or service.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_URL

parameters.description: User name for accessing the Maven repository, if required.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_USERNAME

parameters.description: Password to access the Maven repository, if required.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_PASSWORD

parameters.description: The Service name for the optional Business Central, where it can be reached, to allow service lookups (for example,  maven repo usage), if required.
parameters.displayName: Name of the Business Central service
parameters.name: BUSINESS_CENTRAL_SERVICE

parameters.description: Secret containing the KIE_ADMIN_USER and KIE_ADMIN_PWD values
parameters.name: CREDENTIALS_SECRET

parameters.description: Namespace in which the ImageStreams for Red Hat Process Automation Manager images are installed. These ImageStreams are normally installed in the openshift namespace. You need to modify this parameter only if you installed the ImageStream in a different namespace/project. Default is "openshift".
parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_NAMESPACE

parameters.description: The name of the image stream to use for KIE server. Default is "rhpam-kieserver-rhel8".
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_IMAGE_STREAM_NAME

parameters.description: A named pointer to an image in an image stream. Default is "7.7.1".
parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_TAG

parameters.description: Hibernate persistence schema.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_PERSISTENCE_SCHEMA

parameters.description: KIE server external database Hibernate dialect.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_DIALECT

parameters.description: Sets the datasource service host. Use this if you want to use the predefined mysql or postgresql datasource properties. Leave blank if the KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_URL parameter is set.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_SERVICE_HOST

parameters.description: Sets the datasource service port. Use this if you want to use the predefined mysql or postgresql datasource properties. Leave blank if the KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_URL parameter is set.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_SERVICE_PORT

parameters.description: Sets the datasources type. It can be XA or NONXA. For non XA set it to true. Default value is true.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_NONXA

parameters.description: Sets the datasource jdbc connection url. Note that, if you are using PostgreSQL do not use this field, use the SERVICE_HOST and PORT. If using SERVICE_PORT and HOST there is no need to fill this parameter.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_URL

parameters.description: The predefined driver name, available values are mysql, postgresql or the preferred name for the external driver.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_DRIVER

parameters.description: Database JNDI name used by application to resolve the datasource, e.g. java:/jboss/datasources/ExampleDS.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_JNDI

parameters.description: KIE server external database name. Leave blank if the KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_URL is set.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_DB

parameters.description: KIE server external database user name.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_USER

parameters.description: KIE server external database password.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_PWD

parameters.description: Sets xa-pool/min-pool-size for the configured datasource.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_MIN_POOL_SIZE

parameters.description: Sets xa-pool/max-pool-size for the configured datasource.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_MAX_POOL_SIZE

parameters.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ValidConnectionChecker that provides a SQLException isValidConnection(Connection e) method to validate if a connection is valid.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_CONNECTION_CHECKER

parameters.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ExceptionSorter that provides a boolean isExceptionFatal(SQLException e) method to validate if an exception should be broadcast to all javax.resource.spi.ConnectionEventListener as a connectionErrorOccurred.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_EXCEPTION_SORTER

parameters.description: Sets the sql validation method to background-validation, if set to false the validate-on-match method will be used.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_BACKGROUND_VALIDATION

parameters.description: Defines the interval for the background-validation check for the jdbc connections.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_BACKGROUND_VALIDATION_MILLIS

parameters.description: KIE server external database driver type, applicable only for DB2, possible values are 4 (default) or 2.
parameters.displayName: KIE Server External Database Driver Type
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_EXTERNALDB_DRIVER_TYPE

parameters.description: ImageStreamTag definition for the image containing the drivers and configuration. For example, custom-driver-image:7.7.1.
parameters.name: EXTENSIONS_IMAGE

parameters.description: Namespace within which the ImageStream definition for the image containing the drivers and configuration is located.
parameters.name: EXTENSIONS_IMAGE_NAMESPACE

parameters.description: Full path to the directory within the extensions image where the extensions are located (e.g. install.sh, modules/, etc.).
parameters.name: EXTENSIONS_INSTALL_DIR

parameters.description: The KIE Server mode. Valid values are 'DEVELOPMENT' or 'PRODUCTION'. In production mode, you can not deploy SNAPSHOT versions of artifacts on the KIE server and can not change the version of an artifact in an existing container. (Sets the org.kie.server.mode system property).
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_MODE

parameters.description: KIE server mbeans enabled/disabled (Sets the kie.mbeans and kie.scanner.mbeans system properties).
parameters.name: KIE_MBEANS

parameters.description: KIE server class filtering (Sets the org.drools.server.filter.classes system property).
parameters.name: DROOLS_SERVER_FILTER_CLASSES

parameters.description: If set to false, the prometheus server extension will be enabled. (Sets the org.kie.prometheus.server.ext.disabled system property)
parameters.name: PROMETHEUS_SERVER_EXT_DISABLED

parameters.description: Custom hostname for http service route. Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: insecure-<application-name>-kieserver-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>
parameters.displayName: KIE Server Custom http Route Hostname
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HOSTNAME_HTTP

parameters.description: Custom hostname for https service route.  Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: <application-name>-kieserver-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>
parameters.displayName: KIE Server Custom https Route Hostname
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HOSTNAME_HTTPS

parameters.description: The name of the secret containing the keystore file.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_SECRET

parameters.description: The name of the keystore file within the secret.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_KEYSTORE

parameters.description: The name associated with the server certificate.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_NAME

parameters.description: The password for the keystore and certificate.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HTTPS_PASSWORD

parameters.description: Allows the KIE server to bypass the authenticated user for task-related operations, for example, queries. (Sets the org.kie.server.bypass.auth.user system property)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_BYPASS_AUTH_USER

parameters.description: Sets refresh-interval for the EJB timer database data-store service.
parameters.displayName: Timer service data store refresh interval (in milliseconds)
parameters.name: TIMER_SERVICE_DATA_STORE_REFRESH_INTERVAL

parameters.description: KIE server Container memory limit.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_MEMORY_LIMIT

parameters.description: KIE Server Container deployment configuration with optional alias. Format: containerId=groupId:artifactId:version|c2(alias2)=g2:a2:v2
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_CONTAINER_DEPLOYMENT

parameters.description: Disable management api and don't allow KIE containers to be deployed/undeployed or started/stopped. Sets the property org.kie.server.mgmt.api.disabled to true and org.kie.server.startup.strategy to LocalContainersStartupStrategy.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_MGMT_DISABLED

parameters.description: RH-SSO URL.
parameters.name: SSO_URL

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm name.
parameters.name: SSO_REALM

parameters.description: KIE Server RH-SSO Client name.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_SSO_CLIENT

parameters.description: KIE Server RH-SSO Client Secret.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_SSO_SECRET

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm admin user name for creating the Client if it doesn't exist.
parameters.name: SSO_USERNAME

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm Admin Password used to create the Client.
parameters.name: SSO_PASSWORD

parameters.description: RH-SSO Disable SSL Certificate Validation.
parameters.name: SSO_DISABLE_SSL_CERTIFICATE_VALIDATION

parameters.description: RH-SSO Principal Attribute to use as user name.
parameters.name: SSO_PRINCIPAL_ATTRIBUTE

parameters.description: LDAP Endpoint to connect for authentication.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_URL

parameters.description: Bind DN used for authentication.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN

parameters.description: LDAP Credentials used for authentication.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BIND_CREDENTIAL

parameters.description: The JMX ObjectName of the JaasSecurityDomain used to decrypt the password.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_JAAS_SECURITY_DOMAIN

parameters.description: LDAP Base DN of the top-level context to begin the user search.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BASE_CTX_DN

parameters.description: LDAP search filter used to locate the context of the user to authenticate. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. A common example for the search filter is (uid={0}).
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BASE_FILTER

parameters.description: The search scope to use.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_SEARCH_SCOPE

parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds for user or role searches.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_SEARCH_TIME_LIMIT

parameters.description: The name of the attribute in the user entry that contains the DN of the user. This may be necessary if the DN of the user itself contains special characters, backslash for example, that prevent correct user mapping. If the attribute does not exist, the entry’s DN is used.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_DISTINGUISHED_NAME_ATTRIBUTE

parameters.description: A flag indicating if the DN is to be parsed for the user name. If set to true, the DN is parsed for the user name. If set to false the DN is not parsed for the user name. This option is used together with usernameBeginString and usernameEndString.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_PARSE_USERNAME

parameters.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the start of the DN to reveal the user name. This option is used together with usernameEndString and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_USERNAME_BEGIN_STRING

parameters.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the end of the DN to reveal the user name. This option is used together with usernameEndString and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_USERNAME_END_STRING

parameters.description: Name of the attribute containing the user roles.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_ID

parameters.description: The fixed DN of the context to search for user roles. This is not the DN where the actual roles are, but the DN where the objects containing the user roles are. For example, in a Microsoft Active Directory server, this is the DN where the user account is.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLES_CTX_DN

parameters.description: A search filter used to locate the roles associated with the authenticated user. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. The authenticated userDN is substituted into the filter anywhere a {1} is used. An example search filter that matches on the input username is (member={0}). An alternative that matches on the authenticated userDN is (member={1}).
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_FILTER

parameters.description: The number of levels of recursion the role search will go below a matching context. Disable recursion by setting this to 0.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_RECURSION

parameters.description: A role included for all authenticated users.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_DEFAULT_ROLE

parameters.description: Name of the attribute within the roleCtxDN context which contains the role name. If the roleAttributeIsDN property is set to true, this property is used to find the role object’s name attribute.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_NAME_ATTRIBUTE_ID

parameters.description: A flag indicating if the DN returned by a query contains the roleNameAttributeID. If set to true, the DN is checked for the roleNameAttributeID. If set to false, the DN is not checked for the roleNameAttributeID. This flag can improve the performance of LDAP queries.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_PARSE_ROLE_NAME_FROM_DN

parameters.description: Whether or not the roleAttributeID contains the fully-qualified DN of a role object. If false, the role name is taken from the value of the roleNameAttributeId attribute of the context name. Certain directory schemas, such as Microsoft Active Directory, require this attribute to be set to true.
parameters.displayName: LDAP Role Attribute ID is DN
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_IS_DN

parameters.description: If you are not using referrals, you can ignore this option. When using referrals, this option denotes the attribute name which contains users defined for a certain role, for example member, if the role object is inside the referral. Users are checked against the content of this attribute name. If this option is not set, the check will always fail, so role objects cannot be stored in a referral tree.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_REFERRAL_USER_ATTRIBUTE_ID_TO_CHECK

parameters.description: When present, the RoleMapping Login Module will be configured to use the provided file. This property defines the fully-qualified file path and name of a properties file or resource which maps roles to replacement roles. The format is original_role=role1,role2,role3
parameters.name: AUTH_ROLE_MAPPER_ROLES_PROPERTIES

parameters.description: Whether to add to the current roles, or replace the current roles with the mapped ones. Replaces if set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_ROLE_MAPPER_REPLACE_ROLE
